name: BIVIGAM

indications.text: bivigam immune globulin intravenous ( human ) , 10 % liquid , indicated treatment adults pediatric patients 2 years age older primary humoral immunodeficiency ( pi ) . [ 1 ]

warningsAndPrecautions: bivigam supplied single-use , tamper-evident vial . components used packaging bivigam made natural rubber latex . bivigam supplied following sizes : ndc number size grams protein 69800-6502-1 50ml 5 69800-6503-1 100ml 10
adverseReactions: bivigam contraindicated patients anaphylactic severe systemic reaction human immune globulin . bivigam contraindicated iga deficiency patients antibodies iga history hypersensitivity .
indications_original: BIVIGAM is an Immune Globulin Intravenous (Human), 10% Liquid, indicated for the treatment of adults and pediatric patients 2 years of age and older with primary humoral immunodeficiency (PI). [1]
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
BIVIGAM is supplied in a single-use, tamper-evident vial. The components used in the packaging for BIVIGAM are not made with natural rubber latex.
                  
                  BIVIGAM is supplied in the following sizes:
                  
                     
                        
                           
                              NDC Number
                           
                           
                              Size
                           
                           
                              Grams Protein
                           
                        
                        
                           69800-6502-1
                           50mL
                           5
                        
                        
                           69800-6503-1
                           100mL
                           10
adverseReactions_original:
BIVIGAM is contraindicated in patients who have had an anaphylactic or severe systemic reaction to the administration of human immune globulin.
                     BIVIGAM is contraindicated in IgA deficiency patients with antibodies to IgA and a history of hypersensitivity.
